item.title: India/Accident | Pilot declared “Mayday” seconds after take off
item.description: The Ministry of Civil Aviation of India revealed Saturday that the AI171 Air India Flight pilot, which fell with 242 people on board, declared an emergency Mayday seconds after offspring, and that the aircraft fell almost exactly a minute later. In the first official statement of the Indian government since the accident on Thursday, the Secretary of Civil Aviation, Samir Kumar Sinha, made a minute report of the final moments of the flight. "The plane took off at 13:39, local time, and in seconds, after reaching an altitude of about 650 feet (almost 200 meters), began to sink, that is, to lose altitude," said Sinha. The official added: "At 1:39 PM, the pilot reported the Air Traffic Control (ATC) in Ahmedabad that it was a Mayday." According to the secretary, when the ATC tried to contact the plane again after the emergency call, it did not get any response. "Exactly a minute later, at 1:40 pm, the plane dumped in Meghaninar, a zone about two kilometers from the airport," he added. The ministry also confirmed that 242 people were on board the plane: 230 passengers, two pilots and 10 crew. About the previous state of the device, the secretary said that before the accident, the plane had made the Paris-Delhi-Ahmedabad route without incident. The number of dead in the AI171 flight tragedy of Air India rose to at least 279.

item.title: Macau Museum | Gansu culture exposed until July
item.description:
Until July 13, the Macao Museum will be exhibited entirely dedicated to Chinese culture. This is “Genesis and Spirit-Show of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Gansu”, which “presents the culture of Longyuan and the charm of the Silk Rota”, according to the description of the Cultural Institute
The exhibition “Genesis and Spirit-Show of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Gansu” was inaugurated on the weekend, patent at the Macao Museum until July 13. The show is part of the celebrations of the Cultural Institute (IC) of the “China's Cultural and Natural Heritage Day” of 2025. According to a note issued by the IC, it is intended to “deepen the exchange and cooperation between the interior of China and Macau in the field of intangible cultural heritage”, and it shows Macau helps “actively play the role of 'a base' in promoting excellent traditional Chinese culture”. Inaugurated on Saturday, the cultural initiative has the support of several entities, namely the IC and the Gansu Province Department of Culture and Tourism, and is also co-organized by the Intangible Cultural Heritage Protection Center of Gansu Province and the Gansu Province Music and Dance Group, with so many other supports. Located in the Yellow River Higher Course, the province of Gansu is an important stretch of the old silk route, where several cultures converged and mixed, giving rise to a rich variety of intangible cultural heritage, with strong regional characteristics and ethnic diversity. This heritage, which has been continually accumulated, transmitted and developed, “has become a treasure for the Chinese nation,” says the IC. item.title: Crime | Elderly displeased with dinner kills wife to stab
item.description:
Police suspect that displeasure before dinner may have led a 74 -year -old man to murder his 71 -year -old wife after about 50 years of marriage. The victim will have suffered at least 16 cleaver blows, most of them in the head and neck. The man is indicted for the crime of qualified homicide, which may imply a sentence up to 25 years in prison
Around 5 pm on Friday, a woman found a macabre scenario when she returned home in the Lakes Nam Van. Between the living room and the kitchen, his parents were on the floor in an authentic blood pool. The mother would eventually lose her life following multiple stab wounds and her father would be arrested on suspicion of qualified homicide. According to the Judicial Police, dissatisfaction with what dinner would have been at the source of a contempt that ended in tragedy, with her husband, a 74 -year -old retired to murder her 71 -year -old wife with whom she had been married for about 50 years. When the authorities arrived at the apartment, they found a cleaver and kitchen scissors in the lady's washing and signs of fighting in the kitchen, with blood everywhere. The suspect also presented blows to the head and multiple lacerations that did not need suture and appeared to be in a stable mental state. After receiving medical treatment, he was taken to the Judicial Police for interrogation. The gun of the crime was a cleaver, discovered in the lava-laryl, with which the suspect will have, at least 16 blows to the victim, most in his head and neck. Crime and punishment At a press conference on Saturday, the Judicial Police indicated that it was often for the couple to have discussions for trivial reasons, but without registration of police intervention requests to resolve disputes. The case was referred to the Public Prosecution Service and the man is suspected of the crime of qualified homicide. According to the Penal Code, "if death is produced in circumstances that reveal special censorship or wickedness of the agent, it is punished with prison sentence of 15 to 25 years."

item.title: IIICF | Signed agreements of $ 10.1 billion US dollars
item.description:
The 16th Forum and International Exhibition on Investment Investment and Construction (IIICF) was marked by the signing of 31 cooperation protocols in areas such as transport, construction, electricity, water resources and renewable energy
Thirty-one cooperation protocols, worth US $ 10.1 billion, were signed during an infrastructure forum in Macao. One third involve lusophone and mashed companies, it was announced yesterday. The agreements established during the 16th International Forum and Exhibition on Investment and Construction of Infrastructure (IIICF), with a value of “about $ 10.1 billion US, predict cooperation in domains such as transport, construction, electricity, water resources and renewable energy in 22 countries and regions”, reads in a statement from the Institute for the Promotion of Trade and Investment of Macau. (Ipim). About one third of the signed projects, between Tuesday and Thursday, involve companies from Portuguese and Macao countries. Over the three days, Ipim indicates, more than 200 contact scholarship sessions were organized, with more than 70 counted with the presence of companies from Macao and Hengqin, “which represents an increase of more than 30 percent”, compared to the 52 sessions of the previous year. “These results further highlight the role of Macao as a sino-sirophone platform, as well as the efforts of this region in the proactive joint with national development strategies, especially the construction of the great bay,” writes Ipim. In this sense, the note continues, representatives of Portuguese -speaking countries “recognized the effective role of Macao” as a bridge to establish contacts between companies and institutions in China and Lusophone. “They even revealed that during the IIICF they obtained cooperation agreements with companies in the interior of China in the areas of Information Technology and Electric Engineering, underlining their satisfaction,” reads the IPIM note. In 2003, Beijing established Macao as a platform for the reinforcement of economic and commercial cooperation between China and Portuguese -speaking countries and that same year created the Macao Forum. Great Bay Numbers The Great Bay is a Beijing project that aims to create a worldwide metropolis from the Special Chinese administrative regions of Macao and Hong Kong and nine other cities of the neighboring province of Guangdong, where they inhabit more than 80 million inhabitants. Also launched by Beijing in 2021, the initiative of the in -depth cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Hengqin encompasses an area of ​​about 106 square kilometers. More than 3,500 infrastructure professionals from more than 70 countries and regions participated in this forum, which recorded “a new record in terms of the presence of high-level guests, specifically with almost 70 ministerial level leaders”. During these days the infrastructure development rate “a track, a route”, led by Saudi Arabia, Indonesia and Malaysia, was also released, in which Brazil is the Portuguese-speaking country with the best score. The initiative, announced by Chinese leader Xi Jinping in 2013, involves more than 80 countries in Beijing's International Strategic Strategic Plan to develop maritime, bus and rail connections, but also investment in energy resources.

item.title: Elections | List of the “hand soldier” target of CCAC due to corruption
item.description:
When trying to gather the missing signatures to participate in the elections, the list helps Mutual Grassroots, linked to Wong Wai Man, was the target of another operation of the authorities, with new arrests. The two operations within two days, with several arrests, will even have prevented participation in the elections
The potential list candidate for elections Mutual Help Grassroots, linked to Wong Wai Man, the “Mao Soldier”, will have failed the deadline for delivering missing signatures, after being the target of a commissioned operation against corruption (CCAC), justified with corruption suspicions. This was the second operation of the authorities against members of the potential list within two days, and the exclusion of the elections must be confirmed today by the Commission of Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal). CCAC's operation was announced by the body led by Ieong Seong on Friday without identifying the list of the list. In a statement, about the operation that took place on Thursday, the authorities just stated that they had discovered “a case suspected of offering advantages, including pecuniary advantages, to entice the signing of the form for recognition of the application committee.” Before a candidate for the Legislative Assembly is formed, members need to constitute the so -called application committee and collect between 300 and 500 support signatures. At the time of CCAC's operation, Mutual aid Grassroots was in a race against time to get 77 more valid signatures after some of the signatures originally presented were considered invalid. "CCAC has found that there are at least five individuals involved in the case. These individuals will have enlisted others to sign filing forms with pecuniary advantages or other advantages or will have offered proposition forms already signed," was reported by the authorities. "One of the suspects confessed to the practice of their suspicious criminal act while another suspect confessed to falsifying voter signatures, signing forms of proposition," he was added. Almost confirmed deletion To the All About Macau, Sou Weng, a member of the Iron and Steel Association that serves as the basis for the potential list Mutual Grassroots, acknowledged that the latest operation of CCAC resulted in the detention of the person in charge of collecting missing signatures. The detainee, who was not identified, was in a meeting with a friend when he was taken by the authorities. This person was in charge of collecting the signatures, after Wong Wai Man was arrested the day before by the Judicial Police, allegedly for the crime of exploitation of Mah-Jong, in another judicial case. Given the arrests of the association's latest members, I am Weng admitted as soon as the signatures are most likely to deliver, which excludes from the elections to the list. item.title: Entrepreneurship | Event for local companies wants to capture “angel investors”
item.description:
Macau today hosts an event designed to capture the so -called “angel investors” for local entrepreneurship projects. Macao Angel Investor Network takes place at “The Macao Young Entrepreneur Incubation Center” and aims to support emerging business projects or simply startups that are taking the first steps
It's called “Macau Angel Investor Network”, anything like “Angel Investor Network in Macao” and aims to bring residents closer who want to be successful entrepreneurs and create their own business in an economy that wants to diverse. The event is scheduled for today at Hengqin Development Center, at 517 Avenida da Praia Grande, Nam Tung commercial building, between 11h and 12h30, and has several personalities linked to the local economy, but not only. They are Raphael Chan, Deputy Director of the Directorate of Economics and Technological Development Services (DSEDT), Paulo Andrez, Emeritus President of the “European Business Angel Network” and also figures such as Emanuel Soares, Legal Consultant, U Man Fai, angel investor for the Great Bay and Founder/founder of “Esenia Fund” and even Ung Choi Kun, former deputy to the Legislative Assembly and president of Kun Cheong Holding Ltd and also an “angel investor”. The event is developed by the Association for Entrepreneurship and Innovation for Macao, China and Portuguese -speaking countries, which is linked Marco Duarte Rizzolio. To HM, this explained the main objectives that are behind this initiative. "We want to connect an angel investors to startups and small and medium enterprises (SMEs), fostering the entrepreneurial ecosystem and promoting the economic diversification of Macao." In turn, Alvin Fong, also linked to the organization of this event and president of Direch International, argued that it is intended to “create a platform that brings together knowledge about angel investments, helping in the diversification of Macao's economy”. According to Rizzolio, "Investors Angel, who invest capital in emerging companies, are fundamental to support startups in early stages where financing possibilities are more scarce in the traditional financial sector." “In addition,” he said, the contact network that now runs on Praia Grande Avenue “seeks to bring investors closer to Portuguese -speaking and China countries, creating mutual access to the best projects developed in these regions and reinforcing Macao as a strategic link between the East and the West”. For Alvin Fong, this is the "opportune moment" for the holding of such an event, given that "the world is going through many changes and new opportunities are emerging." According to Marco Duarte Rizzolio, in Macao have already occurred in previous events in an attempt to capture angel investments, "but this is the first time a" Business Angels "network has been created in Macao with Chinese investors and Portuguese -speaking countries." "The conditions to hold this event now arise from various factors, such as the accelerated growth of innovation and technology, the greater digitization and the use of software in business, the need to diversify the local economy, the growing focus on the great bay as a pole of innovation," he said. At issue, there are also factors such as “the joint effort of public and private entities in creating an environment favorable to entrepreneurship”, something that has been greatly enhanced by the pandemic years, defended, having brought Macao and the authorities “a new understanding of the importance of supporting local and regional businesses, making this moment particularly strategic”. Who is who For today's session were invited “Successful Entrepreneurs and Entrepreneurs, some of whom are leaders in their areas”, and their “experience and intelligence add a lot to this event,” said Alvin Fong. Already Marco Duarte Rizzolio, stressed that will be present “people interested in technology and innovation, including some angel investors, representatives of risk capital funds, renowned entrepreneurs and specialists in innovation and business development”. Today's session is an “opportunity to obtain valuable knowledge and expand the network of contacts”, and Marco Duarte Rizzolio highlights personalities such as Paulo Andrez, “recognized international expert in entrepreneurship, innovation and angel investment”, or Ung Choi Kun, “prominent figure in Macao in real estate and education sectors, as well as an angel investor in several companies”. Asked about the main areas in which this initiative is focused on, Rizzolio adds that the event is focused on “startups and SMEs that act on sectors such as technology, intelligent tourism, green economy, health, digital education, logistics or finance”, because they are “sectors with high growth potential and that are aligned in local needs”, namely in the “1+” economic diversification strategy or “1+4” strategy global trends ”. "We want to identify innovative companies that can thrive not only in Macao, but also in the big bay and in international markets," added this official who is also linked to the organization of the startups and entrepreneurship contest, the "929 Challenge". Right moment For Alvin Fong, Macao currently presents potentialities for the connection of business projects to the cities of the Great Bay, all located in Guangdong Province. "Macau has a lot of freedom and flexibility to experience new ideas. In addition, we have received many tourists from around the world. Being one of GBA's eleven cities, Macau is, in fact, an excellent platform," he said. In turn, Marco Duarte Rizzolio speaks of “unique characteristics” of the territory, “like their position as a bridge between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, a stable regulatory environment and tax and financial incentives that can attract investors and startups”. There is also “the increase in the focus on the diversification of the economy beyond the game sector”, with “a fertile ground for innovation and new business”. "In a global scenario of low interest rates, capital markets with some geopolitical friction, investment in technology has presented multiple incomparable from other assets. In this context, the creation of more financial incentives and the strengthening of startup support programs are crucial steps," said the event co-creator. Great competition Despite the potential, the challenges persist, given that “Macao does not have many advantages beyond the game sector,” there is “intense competition in the big bay,” warned Alvin Fong. For Marco Duarte Rizzolio "Challenges are significant," because "the transition from an economy so dependent on the game sector to a more diverse model takes time and requires coordinated efforts." It is also necessary to take into account the opportunities that arise with the integration of MSar on Hengqin Island, Rizzoolio said, which recalls, however, “the challenges related to competitiveness and regulatory adaptation”. "In addition, housing and commercial remodeling requires balance between economic growth and the preservation of local social fabric. It is essential to create policies that encourage entrepreneurship and investment, minimizing the negative impacts of these transformations," he said. Asked whether the authorities have been enough to capture angel investors, both argue that there is more work to do. "This is a good start, but more can be done in the future," said Alvin Fong. Already Marco Duarte Rizzolio, said that "the Government of MSAR has made important efforts", as well as mentioning "several times the need to create a" Business Angels "network." “Macau has supported many initiatives that aim to stimulate investment. It is true that the creation of more financial incentives and the strengthening of startup support programs are crucial steps. It is also necessary to promote Macau more actively as an attractive destination for investors, highlighting its competitive advantages on the international scene. This event is an example of good collaboration between the public and private sector to stimulate ecosystem”, defended Rizzolio. Also noteworthy is that today's close connection with 369, an entity that aims to become “an international hub of science and technology in Macau, giving new generations a greater stage of exploration” of opportunities, ”said Alvin Fong, president of this entity. Marco Duarte Rizzolio stressed that we are facing “an incubator of the Macao ecosystem that has organized several events”.

item.title: Comedy | Jimmy O. Yang acts for the first instead Macau in Broadway
item.description:
July 4th, 5th and 6th deserve to be reserved on the Calendar of Macao Stand-Up Comedy fans. Jimmy O. Yang, Hong Kong comedian who enters series such as “Silicon Valley” and “Space Force”, will act on Broadway Theater. Tickets are on sale today and cost between 480 and 880 patacas
“I have something big to announce: Macao, or Mun, I'm going to be from July 4th to 6th to three shows. It will be my first shows in Macau. The tickets will be for sale on June 13th. Until now, Macao!” This is how comedian Jimmy O. Yang announced on social networks that he will bring his stand-up comedy show for the first time to Macao. The shows are marked for the Broadway Theater. On July 4th and 5th, start at 8:30 pm and on July 6, Sunday, the session starts at 15h. Tickets are on sale today and cost between 480 and 880 patacas. Prior to the shows in Macau, Jimmy O. Yang will act in his homeland, Hong Kong, with five shows already sold out at the neighboring city's coliseum, between today and Sunday, with two matins in the middle. At the age of 38, the comedian already has a long career, not only in stage comedy, but especially in a television series and cinema. The popularity of HBO comedy “Silicon Valley” introduced Jimmy O. Yang to the World, playing a member of a computer programming team that tries to luck in the billionaires of mobile applications. Another recurring role in Jimmy O. Yang's curriculum, was on the Netflix series "Space Force", where he contracted with actors such as Steve Carell, John Malkovich, Ben Schwartz, Diana Silvers, Lisa Kudrow and her father Richard Ouyang. Hong Kong comedian has still entered series such as "The Simpsons", "It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia", "American Dad", among others. In seventh art In about 12 years, Jimmy O. Yang has entered more than two dozen movies. In his filmography there are some unavoidable feature films such as "Crazy Rich Asians", "Love Hard", "Like a Boss" and animations such as "The Monkey King", where he gives voice to the protagonist, "Minions: The Rise of Gru", "The Lego Movie 2" and "Wish Dragon". item.title: Tehran | New explosions heard yesterday in the Iranian capital
item.description: New explosions were heard yesterday in Tehraão, the capital of Iran, on the third day of an Israeli attack on a large scale against the Islamic Republic, an AFP journalist has advanced at the site. Iranian media, Khabar Online and Ham Mihan reported that air defense systems in the west and northwest of Tehran had been activated “to counteract new attacks”, while the Iranian Diary Shargh broadcast a video that showed smoke columns in the east of the capital. The Israelite army guaranteed to have reached more than 80 targets yesterday in Tehran, in night air attacks involving "about fifty fighters." "Throughout the night, the Air Force fighters flew over Tehran and reached infrastructures and targets of the Iranian nuclear project," according to a military statement, quoted by AFP. Israel has reached "more than 80 targets, including the Ministry of Defense [and what Israel describes as] the headquarters of the Iranian [military] nuclear project [the organization of defensive research and innovation, or separate, according to the acronym Persian], as well as targets where the regime hid nuclear files." In turn, the Iranian government announced yesterday that the meter and mosques of Tehran will remain open 24 hours a day for the population to take refuge from Israelite attacks, which resumed the bombing against the Iranian capital at noon. Iranian government spokesman Fatemeh Mohajerani has announced that “mosques, schools and the subway will be available to the public as shelters”, when national media began reporting new Israeli bombing in the neighborhoods of Saadat Abad and Punak, northwest of the capital. The Iranian Portal Khabar Online reported that the Niroo Research Institute in the northwest region of Teerão was attacked by Israel. According to the Young JournaLists Club agency, near the Iranian government, the city's air defenses have already been activated to repel the attack. Between dead and injured The Iranian government spokesman appealed to calm. "Service centers, such as banks and medical centers, are at the service of the public and other centers also have the possibility of some employees to work at a distance," he explained to the media, according to the Iranian official news agency Irna. The war between Israel and Iran, triggered at dawn on June 13 for Israelite bombings that aimed at Iranian military and nuclear facilities, has already caused more than 100 dead and 800 injured in Iran, including military leaders, scientists and civilians. The Israelite attacks, made by 200 aircraft against a hundred targets, reached mainly Tehran (North) and the uranium enrichment centers of Fordow and Natanz (Center), Mehrabad National Airport and various military bases. Iran retaliated with hundreds of missiles directed to the cities of Telavive and Jerusalem, who made at least 13 dead and 150 injured.

item.title: G Dragon | 12 tickets in ticket purchase
item.description: A total of 12 people were circumvented in 87,000 patacas when they sought to buy tickets on the black market for the concerts of singer G Dragon, which took place between June 6 and 8. The case was revealed yesterday by the Judicial Police (PJ), and quoted by the newspaper or Mun. Although the identity of the show artist was not revealed, the South Korean singer was the only one with concerts in Macau in those three consecutive days. According to Modus Operandi, the burns promised to sell tickets to the different days and after receiving the payment were unmistakable. In 10 cases, the burles were made over the internet and in two other occurrences the scores were in person, as the alleged sellers did not attend the time of handing over the tickets. Ticket losses ranged from 1,000 patacas and 25,000 patacas for a total of 87,000 patacas. Online Sales | Burlas generate losses of 25 thousand patacas The Judicial Police (PJ) announced the 19th online sales registration that resulted in losses of 25,000 patacas. According to police information, quoted by the newspaper or Mun, the slips were made through the online sale of shellfish, buffets in local restaurants, amusement parks or local hotel packages. PJ is investigating all cases, which have affected a total of 19 victims, 11 women and 8 men. Regarding the profile of the victims, it was also announced that 16 are middle age and three are young. The victims were deceived after accessing online advertising and paid by bank transfer between June 7 and 11. However, although they made payments never received the goods they bought. In individual terms, the burles ranged from the 320 patacas and 3,800 patacas.

item.title: PAULO MAIA AND CARMO
item.description: Lu Dongbin, the Immortal, waited sitting in a Handan inn, the city of Hebei at Hanshan's term, the reddish purple mountain. He had a porcelain pillow and expected, he would know later, to demonstrate the possibilities offered in the finitude of the flow of the days. Unknowingly, he came to a luminous encounter, Lu Sheng was immersed in obscure thoughts raised by repeated setting of fortune, but would come with the accuracy of the road that would place him face to face with the immortal patient. Having a brief exchange of words, Lu Sheng realized that the lovely man, who was in front of him with the robes of a daoist priest, was available to listen to his complaints. And the disappointed traveler told how he had narrowly disapproved of the Jinshi exam that would allow him a quiet life in the service of the Empire and now even admitting to imagine a future. After listening to him, Lu Dongbin reached out for the pillow he brought and told him to rest a moment while a comforting yellow sorghum porridge cooked to the heat. Soon the traveler fell asleep. And he dreamed the most comforting dream: that passed the imperial exam, knew the most beautiful and intelligent wife, who would give him many children, with whom he would live many years in a well paid and quiet imperial post. Suddenly but awakened from the dream that seemed to have lasted a lifetime. Asking the Master of theist how long he had slept, he replied that the sorghum Pope had not yet bought it yet. The ancient account in which an immortal allows a mortal to live, in fact, another life for a short time to show him the illusory and transitory character of ambitions for himself to deduce another path, would be resumed in 1601 by playwright Tang Xianzu (1550-1616). But it was well known as one of Handan's many proverbs, reduced to four short characters: 黄粱美梦 Huangliang Meimeng, "a good dream, yellow sorghum." Huang Ding (c.1650-1730), a changzhou painter, made a series of paintings "in the way of" augustes painters of the past such as Wang Meng, Dong Yuan or even Nizan's unmistakable style landscapes (vertical roller, ink on paper, 92.7 x 35.1 cm, at the Minneapolis Art Institute) as wanting to embark on his push Long history of painting made for a wide time. At that time a small album was circulated with notes of the influential Dong Qichang, but which is attributed to Wang Shimin (1592-1680) entitled Xiaozhong Xianda, "Revelation of Large Things In Small", which contained, in a small format, recreations of works by great masters. Can you see something too big can be done in a small shape, but a lifetime in a short time? Because what travels is the Spirit, Lu Dongbin made him in less than an hour, the time it takes to cook the yellow sorghum.

item.title: ANA CRISTINA ALVES
item.description: Ana Cristina Alves, auxiliary researcher and coordinator of the Educational Service of the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center May 20, 2025 Cultural Introduction and Comparison What is the implicit popular philosophy in Wu Cheng´en's West Pilgrimage (吴承恩) 1500 - 1582? This was written during the Ming Dynasty and published in 1570, about the time when the Lusíadas de Luís Vaz de Camões, the Camonian epic, would be edited in 1572. In the western pilgrimage, we are looking for an imaginary recreation of a group of pilgrims, headed by the monk of the Tang Xuanzang Dynasty (唐玄奘 Xuánzàng), to conquer a new spiritual world, that of Buddhist religion, to which the Chinese should adhere to a better ethical-moral conduct for a much-diverted population of good teachings and conduct. Those who lead the initiative to free the Chinese from suffering is, of course, the deity of compassion, Guanyin (观音 Guānyīn), always attentive to all distressed souls, ready to launch their help. Already in the case of Os Lusíadas, composed by Luís Vaz de Camões (1524/5-1580), a journey is also narrated, but it is real, inseparable from spiritual and religious aspects, because made in the name of the universality of the Christian faith, but being inseparable from the concrete journey, which implies the very human and Renaissance conquest of a better world for people, in which the Portuguese can not the Portuguese Just survive, but command and imperate, because they are worthy of an old history and very valuable warriors. Therefore, the heroism of the discoveries, living in the Christian faith, but accompanied and protected by the Renaissance Belling that recovers the classic spirit and deities, such as the protective Venus, a loving deity that sails for the Portuguese, and the aggressive and jealous Bacchus, the god of wine who wants to lose them. The west pilgrimage by the Chinese is performed in the name of collective liberation and salvation, through contact with Buddhist sutras; The Portuguese “pilgrimage” to the east is also in the name of a collectivity, saves souls and extends to the whole land, given the proselytist vocation of Christianity and globalizing merchants, as well as the navigators, Camões his poetic herald desires the spread of faith by a great empire built by Portuguese heroes, as read in the first resort of singing first: The weapons and the barons marked That of the western Lusitana beach, By seas never of before navigadas Also passed beyond TAPROBAN, In hardworking dangers and wars, More than promised human strength, And among remote people built New kingdom, which so sublimated; That would be translated into Chinese by Zhang Weimi 张维民 in 19981 as follows: 威武的船队 ， 强悍的勇士 ， 驶离卢济塔尼亚西部海岸 ， 越过自古茫无人迹的海崖 ， 甚至跨越塔普罗瓦那海角 ， 经历千难万险、无穷战争 ， 超出人力所能承受的极限 ， 在那荒僻遥远的异域之帮 ， 将灿烂辉煌的新帝国拓建。 张维民 (译) 《卢济塔尼亚人之歌 • 第一章 ， 一》 Both pilgrimages are true poetic adventure novels, the Lusíadas in poetry, the west pilgrimage in poetic prose and poetry. In the latter, Bodhisattva Guanyin will subdue 4 monsters who will be the companions of the monk Xuanzang. Bodhisattva takes an embroidered accent and a nine -lap ring to deliver to the monk. The latter, if effectively fulfilling his 14 -year mission, escapes the wheel of reincarnation (Jenner, 1994: 60), and his disciples, disobedient divine forces falling into the human world, will be able to return to heaven, where they will again occupy divine positions. Guanyin also delivers a band, which causes terrible headaches to the disobedient King Monkey (Jenner, 1994: 60). The monsters and indomitable spirits are presented. First Sun Wukong (孙悟空 Sūn Wǔkōng), by King's disobedient monkey transits the obedient guardian of the Buddhist religion. Guanyin will free this indomitable spirit, prisoner in the mountain of the five elements (五行山 wǔxing shān), as punishment for the disobediences they have no account. Then a heavenly marshal who will pass the pig. He is Marshal Tian Peng (天篷 Tiān Péng) of the Milky Way, tried to seduce the Divinity of the Moon, was punished by the emperor of Jade with axes and condemned to exile on earth. Bodhisattva baptized him with the nickname of Zhu Bajie (猪八戒 Zhū Bājiè), which means "Pig of the eight abstinences," and gave him the name Buddhist of Zhu Wuneng (猪悟能 Zhū Wǔnéng), ie "awakening pork for power" (1994: 63). There will be an ogre that will be dominated and transformed into a sand monk. He was punished for being a distracted heavenly general. He paid the distraction with 800 whipping, having been exiled to Earth, where he devours travelers hidden in the waters of the floating river. Guanyin frees him, baptizing him with the nickname "sand" (沙 shā), and the Buddhist name of Wujing (牾净 Wǔjìng), which means "awake to purity." Follows is the son of the West Sea Dragon King who will be metamorphosed on a white horse. He was denounced by his own father for burning the bright pearls of the palace. Jade emperor punished him, suspending him in the air. He gave him 300 whips, letting him wait for death. Prince Dragon is freed to turn into the white horse of the Xuánzàng monk, or as he is known in Chinese, on the white-dragon horse, (白龙马 白龙马 Lóng Mǎ). In the term of the pilgrimage, Zhu Wuneng spiritualized, ascends to heaven, being rewarded with the heavenly position of cleans. But there are more honors to the group of victorious pilgrims who led the Sutras to China: the sand monk will receive the title of Golden Holy (Arhat), the monkey will be named Buddha of the victorious fight and the Sanzang monk will receive the title of Buddha do Merit (Buddha Candana-Punya.) As well as the white horse will rise the heavenly dragon. Proverbial popular philosophy Among the pilgrims are, as is well known, the monkey and the pig that escorts the great monk and Buddhist translator Xuanzang [唐玄奘 Xuánzàng (c. 602-664) or Sanzang (三藏 Sānzàng), the monk of the three Buddhist treasures (Buddha himself, teachings or Dharma, the monastic order or Sangha), the monastic order), Mandated by Emperor Emperor Táng Tàzōng (唐太宗, R. 626-649) to go to the Holy Scriptures from India. These will be delivered by the historic Buddha that resides in the Pico do Vulture, because "there are many greedy and evil creatures in the east, which are bought to cause suffering to others, killing and fighting nonstop." (Jenner, 1994: 58). Therefore, Buddha wanted to distribute the Scriptures through the Chinese world. In popular and proverbial philosophy, which today rushes from mouth to mouth, it is drawn to the existential duel, between two of the five pilgrims, very similar to that of the work Don Quixote, by Miguel de Cervantes (1547-1616), composed between 1605 and 1615, in which the author puts in dialogue two opposing and complementary characters, Don Quixote and Sancho Pança: Romantic, dreamer and even utopian, almost only skin and bone, as it is like an incarnate spirit; The second, materialist, realistic, pragmatic, a very strong and plump "feet". Mutatis Mutandis Zhu Bajie, the eight abstinence pig, and Sun Wugong, the west -west -awake to emptiness, have many of the opposite and complementary characteristics we find in D. Quixote and Sancho Pança. To confirm it, be aware of some of the said proverbials associated with King Monkey: 1) The seventy -two transformations of the monkey king (七十二变 qī shí èr bàn) 2) endless mutations (千变万化 qiān biàn wàn huà) 3) great confusion in the heavenly palace (大闹天宮 大闹天宮 nao tiān gōng) 4) Infinite Magic Powers (神通广大 Shéntōng-Guǎnggdà) 5) Appears and mysteriously disappears (神出鬼没 Shénchū-guǐmò) He has an infinite spiritual ability, which allows him to accompany the universal movement and be in permanent transformation. It has numerous magical powers, learned from the best of Taoist masters, which enables him to successfully interfere in both the heavenly and earthly order, which is why he will be punished and only subjugated by the Buddha himself, which, tame it reveals it belongs to a superior spiritual and religious order. After a five hundred -year -old punishment, inflicted by the Buddhism patriarch, will be able to join the group of pilgrims that will successfully introduce sutras and Buddhist teachings in China. Sun Wugong reveals to be a complex and multifaceted character, retaining and enhancing the best and worst of human nature in his portentous intelligence, challenging and disobedient. It has a lot of difficulty in dealing with Zhu Bajie, for the stupidity and lust of the partner, always ready to sloth out and surrender to exclusively carnal pleasures. Zhu Bajie embodies some of the typical defects of human nature that are well revealed in the popular proverbial philosophy, as can be seen by some of the said mentioned: 1) Zhū Bájiè fails and never assumes his responsibilities (豬八戒上陈 Zhū Bájiè Shàng Chén) 2) Zhu Bajie is adorned with flowers (豬八戒戴花 Zhū Bájiè dài huā). 3) Zhū Bájiè is the mirror (CZHū Bájiè Kàn Jìngzi) 4) Zhū Bájiè departed by plane (豬八戒坐飞机 Zhū Bájiè Zuò Fēijī). In the first proverb, there is the difficulty of the pig to assume guilt whenever it makes mistakes, and how to make mistakes is human, there are no accounts at the times when shaking responsibilities; Already in the second is denounced a very characteristic defect between the people, the vanity, that is, the constant need for ornaments, and not only from the physical point of view, because here not only counts the clothing but also the titles, positions and honors, in a total inability to strictly self -evaluate. In the third said, the physical and moral fealade, which attracts complaints from others, for the lack of composure and, finally, this expression is used when someone goes to the best, but in a worse way, that is, without dignity. Finally, here are some more generally meaningful proverbs, taken from the west pilgrimage, who draw attention to the general evils of the world through the adventures of pilgrims, since, except Sun Wugong, others are very easily fooled by all kinds of monsters, demons, seductive spirits, etc., having great difficulty unraveling hypocritical behaviors in which they stumble through Journey, where they find “many guys to which they cannot see their hearts” or, in other words, abundant hypocrisy, as said (虚情假意 xū qing jiǎ yì). Therefore, they are constantly involved in sarilhos or situations that “have no feet or head”, which is literally translated into Chinese by “unequal sizes” (七长八短 qīm tea bā duān). Now in a misleading world, pilgrims are those who with good intentions go with the greatest goal of saving China, so the group finds itself in the situation of “big ship, great storm”, or as it is said in Chinese, “great tree that attracts the wind” (树大招风 shūo fēng) in a world where when virtue grows a few centimeters, so wickedness increases several meters (， ， ， ， ， ， ， Give gāo yī chǐ, mó gāo yī zhàng). Despite all the warnings, coming from popular wisdom and Romanesque adventures, the west pilgrimage and the Lusíadas end with the success of its protagonists, as the Portuguese expand around the world, Buddhism is introduced in China and all the characters in the poetic soap opera give rise to a proverbial source pedagogical. item.title: June 10 | Alexandre Leitão highlights the end of the waiting lists at the Consulate
item.description:
Yesterday was held at the consular residence in Bela Vista, the usual celebration ceremony of June 10-Portugal, Camões and the Portuguese Communities. Alexandre Leitão, Consul, highlighted the end of the waiting lists in the consulate and the modernization of some services, noting that Portugal is ready to promote stronger economic ties with the MSAR
After years when renewing the citizen card or passport could be a small major problem for Portuguese citizens to reside in the MSAR, since this subject seems to be solved. Alexandre Leitão, Portuguese consul-general in Macao and Hong Kong, proved yesterday to be a satisfied man to talk about the last achievements achieved in the operation of the Portuguese Consulate-General in Macau and Hong Kong, this regards the June 10th, Portugal, Camões and Portuguese Communities celebrations. "After two years of intense concentration in the normalization of consular services, we eliminated waiting lists in the field of issuing citizen cards and passports," he said. According to Alexandre Leitão, "users have returned access to 90 percent of services without prior appointment, we introduced electronic payment, we drastically reduce response and referral times after the admission of processes, and reorganize human resources and procedures." The consul did not forget the consulate's team, "which is constituted, almost in full, by Macanese who have positively reacted to the successive challenges that have been presented to them", also noting that "in 15 months were emitted or renewed 55 thousand cards of citizen and passports, which also demonstrates the dimension of the Portuguese community of Macau and Hong Kong." Portugal with value Thus, the official said he could “safely say that the essential, from the strictly consular point of view, is done”, but intends to bet on the “deepening of Portugal's diplomatic, economic and cultural relations with the special administrative regions” of Macao and Hong Kong. Addressing the Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, Alexandre Leitão recalled that the ruler “has defended the acceleration of the opening and diversification of the economy” and that from this point of view Portugal has a privileged role to fulfill. "Portugal has the same purpose, which makes us, once again, bridged in a common purpose: to grow and diversify our economies, internationalizing them for the benefit of our peoples. item.title: Satellite Casinos | Government says that closing impact will be controlled
item.description:
It is official: the 11 satellite casinos will even end doors until December 31 this year, and Melco and the Macao Game Society have already announced the restructuring plans. Regarding the affected workers, the government presents numbers lower than those already mentioned by deputies and associations: 5,600. An impact on SMEs is still expected, but without a major consequence for banks
After much speculation, here is finally the authorities and operators have announced what will actually happen to the 11 satellite casinos operated in the territory. They all will close, and the Macau Game Society (SJM) Resorts and Melco have already defined the plans for what follows [see secondary text], which includes acquisitions of L'ARC and Bridge 16, as well as the transfer of workers and game machines. The executive presented yesterday, at a press conference, numbers of workers affected with the closing of the satellite casinos below those already referred to by sector associations. It will, after all, will be 5,600 and no more than ten thousand as some deputies said to these entities, and from this cake, 4,800 workers were directly hired by the operators of the game, so if the satellite casino, they can be integrated into their paintings. The rest, 800, were contracted directly by the satellite casinos themselves. There are still 400 non -resident workers (TNR) involved in this process. With regard to Mocha Clubs, 300 local workers and 50 TNR. Tai Kin IP, secretary for the economy and finance, said that "the data were collected by different means", but that the government calculations "are official". "As the other means came to this data, I don't know," he added. Asked about the support of these 800 workers, the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, explained that "the owners of the satellite casinos have the responsibility to ensure the work relationship of these people." "In the case of the 4,800 hired by the dealers, such as Croupiers or Treasury Employees, they can return to work in these dealers' casinos. In relation to 800, the concessionaires have guaranteed the government that if they have employment problems they can absorb them and provide adequate jobs on the properties of the dealers," he said. Representative Song Pek Kei even talked about the possibility of about 15,000 unemployed, while Nick Law, in a plenary intervention, said that among the satellite casinos and associated stores, there were "13,500 workers", representing "4.6 percent of the total macao work force". POSSIBILITY OF CONVERSION Regarding small and medium-sized companies (SMEs) located in the neighborhoods that will no longer have these satellite casinos, namely in areas such as the Inner Port, Zape, Nape or Fishermen's Dock, the government predicts some impact but controlled. There are, in total, 320 stores that operate in the vicinity with 800 workers, and “about 400 workers will have another employment situation according to the reconversion of stores,” said Secretary Tai Kin IP. Essentially, and after the government's surveys, half of the 320 stores "will be affected directly by the satellite casinos closure, such as the pledge houses, mobile phones, restaurants and jewelery." However, Tai Kin IP pointed out that there will be others that will not have a great impact on depending on sales to residents. Above all, the ruler pointed out that this scenario may even constitute an opportunity. "It will be a challenge and an opportunity for the reconversion of stores. Traditional stores that have a close relationship with satellite casinos customers have to reconvert. Highlight that Hospitality Consultant Savills referred in March that the satellite casinos closure would devalue the hotels in 60 percent and cause more non-compliance with the SMEs, with bank credit obligations valued between 25 and 39 billion. Tai Kin IP devalued this scenario. “From the knowledge we have, the loans granted to satellite casinos involve less than 1 percent of all bank loan activity, and we find that the risks are very limited to the operation of banks. In terms of risk supervision indicators in the financial industry, such as capital flow and others, banks' behavior will be safe and stable.” Regarding the SMEs, Tai Kin IP said that the monetary and currency of Macao is “closely monitoring the situation with the banks to mitigate the recovery of customers”, and the secretary in advance that in April, “ten billion patacas were injected to loans to the SMEs, attenuating their pressures”. Asked about the timing of these measures, André Cheong said it is the right time. "It all depends on the dealerships' decisions and we now officially receive the decision. This is a problem that has to do with several casinos and a considerable number of workers, and we did not want that only at the end of the year they knew about their situation. With six months to finish the transition period we understand that this is the indicated phase to advertise," he said. No impact on recipes Given the budgetary revision for this year with 12 billion Patacas in the forecast of game revenues, André Cheong assured that the satellite casinos closure will not have a major impact on the overview of revenues. "We made the budgetary review with less 12 billion patacas due to lack of consumption. We believe that the closure of satellite casinos does not have great impact on the game's recipes," he said. The secretary also stressed that, as for the intention of SJM Resorts to purchase the enterprises Ponte 16 and L'ARC, the concessionaire "has to conclude this acquisition procedure until December 31, and if they cannot buy these satellite casinos [who operate in the projects] have to end."

item.title: Pecunaries Checks | Former Beneficiaries defend better assignment criteria
item.description:
Given the changes to the pecuniary reimbursement plan, HM has heard three permanent residents who will no longer receive the check because they do not reside permanently in Macao, including a macanese born in the territory. Arnaldo Gonçalves, academic and former Beneficiary, defends a better distribution of support depending on the income of families
The rules for the attribution of pecuniary checks will change and now it is really necessary to be 183 days a year in the territory. The exceptions are some and arrest with students from Macau who are attending courses abroad or residents to work remotely to Macau and who are enrolled in the Social Security Fund, among other situations. However, many people will be left out, even though they have lived for several decades in the territory or even macanese born in Macau, that is, many of the members of the Macanese diaspora. In the case of Arnaldo Gonçalves, a permanent resident resident in Lisbon, he lived several decades in Macau, having worked for the government and was a university professor in the area of ​​political science. Six years ago, he returned to Portugal, being renovated, and told HM that he was already waiting for the day he was going to stop receiving the ten thousand dates annually. "This measure aims to give people a counterpart, given the difficulties existing in consumption and the characteristics of life. I don't live in Macau, and I think from the point of view of equity, the government has never been able to make a fairer regime from the distributive point of view, because there is no system of attribution from the income, and deep down there are multimillionaires that gain the subseck, like the pensioners, all," he said. This is what Arnaldo Gonçalves says "lament". "It is hard work to make an assessment of people's economic possessions, and so everyone receives the same as it is more practical in administrative terms," ​​he said. Maria João Ferreira, macaense of gem, daughter of the famous poet Adé, will also fail to receive the pecuniary check. He says he understands, but also criticizes the executive's positions. "I was already waiting and accepted with all the tranquility. It is fair, since I do not live there and I have the chance to be 183 days. I thank the time of checks that was dismissed. I lived in Macau until I was 16, but I was born there and still have family. Even the pandemic was there every year of vacation. mentioned. Maria João Ferreira, currently in the direction of Macao's house in Lisbon, says she was “shocked” with a very concrete case. "A few years ago, when he was doing his doctorate, he learned of a civil servant who did two service committees in Macao and was a contemplated BIR money and even told me, not just me, that I thought it was funny as he was there so recently, he was entitled to such a benefit," he said. "This is what I think is bad. It is one thing to go to do a service committee in public administration, or two or three, but it was never, in fact, resident. It is, as it were, an immigrant, because it will only work. This is how I see things," he added. Patacas Amealdas For Arnaldo Gonçalves, the ten thousand annual patacas served as a “Management Fund” for trips to the territory, where he still has family and where he travels frequently. "I've never used this money for personal purposes, you know? But I think these changes are a good measure, justifiable, and I even think it's selfish, that I've been entitled to this support for so many years. There are other people who need it," he said. In the case of Maria João Ferreira, the cash of the pecuniary check was also used for expenses in Macao and with trips to the territory. "I have an account in Macao, and when I went there, if I needed to buy the plane ticket, my sister said the money here, or this money served to fund my stay in Macao," he explained. Sofia Mota, a permanent resident and former Maradora in Macao, regrets the absence of explanations for these changes. "It depends on what the pecuniary check is for, whether it is a way of distributing the wealth or profits of casinos to the people who are part of the territory, or have already done; either if it is a condition to be part of the territory. I do not realize the premise in which the pecuniary check measure is based, and depending on the premise these changes may be more or less acceptable." The teacher considers that "it makes no sense that those who contribute to social security at their own initiative, as is my case, are not covered." "It seems that there is a first and second and second social security system. People who come to Portugal to provide family care seem not to be covered and yet are out of the territory for reasons of force majeure. What is meant by providing subsistence to family members, is not realizing the function of the check and the coherence of exceptions," he said. Sofia Mota confesses that she also used money to "a management fund to go to Macau, or to invest in formation." The first reactions The changes to the pecuniary reimbursement program were presented at the end of May and report that three groups will be exempt from the obligation to be 183 days a year in Macao and thus receive the check. They are the residents under 22 in 2024 and where one parent meets the requirements for receiving the check; the beneficiaries of the disability pension and the beneficiaries of disability allowance. There are eight other situations where residents may have access to the check. This is what happens when residents attend higher education outside the territory; When they are hospitalized in a hospital outside the sons, those who are over 65 and live in the interior of China or, even under 65, have health reasons that justify the permanence inside China. Residents who work outside Macao are also covered by the exceptions to an employer registered at the MSAR Social Security Fund and residents outside the MSAR who are responsible for the family aggregate subsistence. These are also attached to the exercise of official functions outside Macao; the registration of domicile, work or study in the deepened cooperation zone; And yet the work done in the cities of large bay except Hong Kong that is left out. Deputy Pereira Coutinho manifested against the changes to the pecuniary check referring to violate the Macao Basic Law, namely in article 25, which guarantees the equality of the residents of Macao before the law and prohibits discrimination. The article determines that "the residents of Macao are equal before the law, without discrimination due to nationality, ancestry, race, gender, language, religion, political or ideological convictions, economic instruction and situation or social condition." More recently, the Macao Synergy Association publicly stated that changes to the pecuniary reimbursement plan in economic development are not in accordance with the wishes of the population. Ron Lam also criticized the executive for applying the changes “in a hurry” which only came to cause more controversy: “the government was in a hurry and applied a sudden measure, without making any public consultation, with only behind -the -scenes movements leading to the population to question governance,” he said. "Consultations with local associations were simulated, which only generated more criticism and caused more unnecessary controversy," he added.

item.title: Entrepreneurship | Event for local companies wants to capture “angel investors”
item.description:
Macau today hosts an event designed to capture the so -called “angel investors” for local entrepreneurship projects. Macao Angel Investor Network takes place at “The Macao Young Entrepreneur Incubation Center” and aims to support emerging business projects or simply startups that are taking the first steps
It's called “Macau Angel Investor Network”, anything like “Angel Investor Network in Macao” and aims to bring residents closer who want to be successful entrepreneurs and create their own business in an economy that wants to diverse. The event is scheduled for today at Hengqin Development Center, at 517 Avenida da Praia Grande, Nam Tung commercial building, between 11h and 12h30, and has several personalities linked to the local economy, but not only. They are Raphael Chan, Deputy Director of the Directorate of Economics and Technological Development Services (DSEDT), Paulo Andrez, Emeritus President of the “European Business Angel Network” and also figures such as Emanuel Soares, Legal Consultant, U Man Fai, angel investor for the Great Bay and Founder/founder of “Esenia Fund” and even Ung Choi Kun, former deputy to the Legislative Assembly and president of Kun Cheong Holding Ltd and also an “angel investor”. The event is developed by the Association for Entrepreneurship and Innovation for Macao, China and Portuguese -speaking countries, which is linked Marco Duarte Rizzolio. To HM, this explained the main objectives that are behind this initiative. "We want to connect an angel investors to startups and small and medium enterprises (SMEs), fostering the entrepreneurial ecosystem and promoting the economic diversification of Macao." In turn, Alvin Fong, also linked to the organization of this event and president of Direch International, argued that it is intended to “create a platform that brings together knowledge about angel investments, helping in the diversification of Macao's economy”. According to Rizzolio, "Investors Angel, who invest capital in emerging companies, are fundamental to support startups in early stages where financing possibilities are more scarce in the traditional financial sector." “In addition,” he said, the contact network that now runs on Praia Grande Avenue “seeks to bring investors closer to Portuguese -speaking and China countries, creating mutual access to the best projects developed in these regions and reinforcing Macao as a strategic link between the East and the West”. For Alvin Fong, this is the "opportune moment" for the holding of such an event, given that "the world is going through many changes and new opportunities are emerging." According to Marco Duarte Rizzolio, in Macao have already occurred in previous events in an attempt to capture angel investments, "but this is the first time a" Business Angels "network has been created in Macao with Chinese investors and Portuguese -speaking countries." "The conditions to hold this event now arise from various factors, such as the accelerated growth of innovation and technology, the greater digitization and the use of software in business, the need to diversify the local economy, the growing focus on the great bay as a pole of innovation," he said. At issue, there are also factors such as “the joint effort of public and private entities in creating an environment favorable to entrepreneurship”, something that has been greatly enhanced by the pandemic years, defended, having brought Macao and the authorities “a new understanding of the importance of supporting local and regional businesses, making this moment particularly strategic”. Who is who For today's session were invited “Successful Entrepreneurs and Entrepreneurs, some of whom are leaders in their areas”, and their “experience and intelligence add a lot to this event,” said Alvin Fong. Already Marco Duarte Rizzolio, stressed that will be present “people interested in technology and innovation, including some angel investors, representatives of risk capital funds, renowned entrepreneurs and specialists in innovation and business development”. Today's session is an “opportunity to obtain valuable knowledge and expand the network of contacts”, and Marco Duarte Rizzolio highlights personalities such as Paulo Andrez, “recognized international expert in entrepreneurship, innovation and angel investment”, or Ung Choi Kun, “prominent figure in Macao in real estate and education sectors, as well as an angel investor in several companies”. Asked about the main areas in which this initiative is focused on, Rizzolio adds that the event is focused on “startups and SMEs that act on sectors such as technology, intelligent tourism, green economy, health, digital education, logistics or finance”, because they are “sectors with high growth potential and that are aligned in local needs”, namely in the “1+” economic diversification strategy or “1+4” strategy global trends ”. "We want to identify innovative companies that can thrive not only in Macao, but also in the big bay and in international markets," added this official who is also linked to the organization of the startups and entrepreneurship contest, the "929 Challenge". Right moment For Alvin Fong, Macao currently presents potentialities for the connection of business projects to the cities of the Great Bay, all located in Guangdong Province. "Macau has a lot of freedom and flexibility to experience new ideas. In addition, we have received many tourists from around the world. Being one of GBA's eleven cities, Macau is, in fact, an excellent platform," he said. In turn, Marco Duarte Rizzolio speaks of “unique characteristics” of the territory, “like their position as a bridge between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, a stable regulatory environment and tax and financial incentives that can attract investors and startups”. There is also “the increase in the focus on the diversification of the economy beyond the game sector”, with “a fertile ground for innovation and new business”. "In a global scenario of low interest rates, capital markets with some geopolitical friction, investment in technology has presented multiple incomparable from other assets. In this context, the creation of more financial incentives and the strengthening of startup support programs are crucial steps," said the event co-creator. Great competition Despite the potential, the challenges persist, given that “Macao does not have many advantages beyond the game sector,” there is “intense competition in the big bay,” warned Alvin Fong. For Marco Duarte Rizzolio "Challenges are significant," because "the transition from an economy so dependent on the game sector to a more diverse model takes time and requires coordinated efforts." It is also necessary to take into account the opportunities that arise with the integration of MSar on Hengqin Island, Rizzoolio said, which recalls, however, “the challenges related to competitiveness and regulatory adaptation”. "In addition, housing and commercial remodeling requires balance between economic growth and the preservation of local social fabric. It is essential to create policies that encourage entrepreneurship and investment, minimizing the negative impacts of these transformations," he said. Asked whether the authorities have been enough to capture angel investors, both argue that there is more work to do. "This is a good start, but more can be done in the future," said Alvin Fong. Already Marco Duarte Rizzolio, said that "the Government of MSAR has made important efforts", as well as mentioning "several times the need to create a" Business Angels "network." “Macau has supported many initiatives that aim to stimulate investment. It is true that the creation of more financial incentives and the strengthening of startup support programs are crucial steps. It is also necessary to promote Macau more actively as an attractive destination for investors, highlighting its competitive advantages on the international scene. This event is an example of good collaboration between the public and private sector to stimulate ecosystem”, defended Rizzolio. Also noteworthy is that today's close connection with 369, an entity that aims to become “an international hub of science and technology in Macau, giving new generations a greater stage of exploration” of opportunities, ”said Alvin Fong, president of this entity. Marco Duarte Rizzolio stressed that we are facing “an incubator of the Macao ecosystem that has organized several events”.

item.title: Environment | Macau registers a new maximum temperatures in 2024
item.description:
The direction of environmental protection services yesterday launched new data on the environmental landscape in the territory, in the Macao Encounters of the Macao 2024. The data is not encouraging: last year a new record of maximum temperatures, more rain and typhoons were recorded. More electricity and water was spent, more garbage was produced and fewer recyclable waste was collected
Lusa The Macao Government, through the Directorate of Environmental Protection Services (DSPA) announced yesterday that 2024 reached a maximum temperature record in the territory, and there was also an increase in typhoons and precipitation. According to the Macau 2024 state report, the average temperature last year was 23.6 ° C, precisely the value that had been reached in 2019, the highest since the records began, in 1952. The average temperature of 2024 was 0.8 ° C higher than the average climacteric (average of 30 years, between 1991 and 2020), according to the document prepared by DSPA. In addition, Macau registered 42 days considered to be hot last year, more 10.7 days than the climacteric average, 29 hot nights, more 17.5 than the average, and 29 cold days, less 10.1 days than the average. Meteorological and geophysical services (SMG) classify as hot days when the maximum temperature is equal to or greater than 33ºC and the nights at which the minimum temperature is at least 28ºC. As for the days considered cold, they are those at which the minimum temperature does not exceed 12ºC. "With global warming, the occurrence of extreme weather phenomena is increasingly frequent," said DSPA in the report. In 2024, Macau was affected by seven tropical cyclones, known as tuffons, and for the first time three tropical cyclones affected Macao in November, the last month of the Typhoons, which begins in May. According to the report, the region last year received a total precipitation of 2,029.2 millimeters, "slightly higher than the climacteric average." DSPA also said that since 1970, sea level in Macao has risen at an average rate of about 3.5 millimeters per year. Also worldwide, 2024 was the hottest year that there are records and exceeded for the first time the 1.5 ° C above the pre-industrial level, in January the copernicus European service advanced in January. Last week, the world weather organization predicted that temperatures should continue to reach record values ​​by the end of the decade. More people, more expenses The DSPA report also tells that with the arrival of more tourists to Macau, there were also more waste and spending on water consumption, for example. "With the improvement of the economy, the number of visitors in 2024 increased 23.8 percent in annual terms for almost 35 million, having recovered about 90 percent of the pre-pound level. Tourist intensity also registered a certain increase, with GDP [Gross Domestic Product] climbed 8.8 percent. In addition, there was a slight increase in the population at the end of the year." Thus, it is added, "in relation to environmental indicators, economic and population growth led to the rise of estimated local emissions of greenhouse gases, invoiced water volume, electricity consumption and the amount of urban solid waste, compared to 2023". "During the pandemic, there was a decrease in the various economic and environmental indicators. However, with the constant improvement of the economy, most of these indicators rose again," is explained. With regard to the volume of invoiced water, in thousands of cubic meters, by 2023 the record was 89,164 and last year, 94.123, which constitutes an increase of 5.6 percent. Regarding electricity consumption, in millions of kW/h, in 2023 it was 5,740, while in 2024 consumption went to 6,030, plus 5.1 percent. The report also highlights the tons of urban solid waste produced, which in 2023 was 501,512, rising 5.1 percent last year to 526,979 tons. Another worrying fact of waste level was the fall, for the third consecutive year, the volume of recyclable waste collected, which went from 24.5 percent at 2021 to 21.7 percent last year. Changed for kids, of all recyclable waste generated in Macao, only about one fifth are collected for recycling. In the report, IP Kuong Lam, director of DSPA, indicates that last year, "with the ongoing economic recovery, there was greater pressure on various environmental indicators, while climate change became more severe." Despite the results, the official said that the objectives are "to encourage greater participation of the population in environmental initiatives and together to achieve the view of building a macao with low carbon emissions." A question of gases The report released yesterday by DSPA also accounts for the panorama of greenhouse gases (GHG) gases, and last year, a global increase of “about ten percent, including carbon dioxide (C02), which represented 90 percent”. It also highlights DSPA that “the estimated emissions of GHE from the various sources have registered upon the same period (2023), except for landfill residues, and the most significant increases were verified in estimated emissions from local electricity production and air transport”. In addition, it is stated that, in 2024, the main source of Emission of GHG and CO2 was land transport, followed by local electricity production, waste incineration, trade, domestic consumption and services. "The main sources of CH4 emissions [methane] were the waste deposited in landfills and the treatment of wastewater, while the latter was also the main source of N2O emission [nitrous oxide]," he stresses in the document. DSPA clarifies, regarding the tendency of GHG emissions, that "after reaching the peak in 2017, local Emissions of GHG showed a decreasing tendency, year after year, having reached its lower value during the pandemic." However, with the recovery of economic activities and the great movement of people, especially "in the last two years, the estimated emissions of these gases has gradually rise again." The air we breathe Also as regards air quality data is not encouraging, because in 2024 “the number of days with the average quality of the air classified as 'Moderate' registered in the six Macao air quality monitoring stations reached 88 percent, slightly lower than 2023”. There was, in a total of the year, 15 to 34 days with “unhealthy” classification, and only two days obtained the classification of “very unhealthy”. According to DSPA, “the pollutants detected in the air monitoring stations were mainly ozone (O3) and thin particles suspended (PM2.5)”, while “at Berma da Estrada station (Ká-Hó), the highest index detected all year round, classified as 'very unhealthy', was the O3 the main pollutant”. Last year, July was the best air quality month, while October to December obtained the worst qualification according to data from Macao air monitoring stations. The report also reveals that “in terms of compliance with atmospheric pollutant concentrations in 2024, the average annual concentrations of PM10 and PM2.5 registered in the various monitoring stations were lower than the standard values”, while “the average annual concentrations of nitrogen dioxide (NO2) were also below standard values, except for the stem station station. (Macao) and at the High Density Areas station (Macau) ”. More optimistic data is also revealed “daily averages of sulfur dioxide concentrations (SO2) and the maximum averages of eight hours of carbon monoxide concentrations (CO) verified in the various stations throughout the year”, as “both were below standard values”. “In all seasons there was a record of the maximum averages of eight hours of O3 concentrations to exceed standard values ​​in some days. In relation to atmospheric pollutant concentrations recorded in the monitoring stations, generally the average annual concentrations of PM2.5 and NO2, while PM10 and CO descended”, and “as in the road station season (Macao) Only in 2024 did SO2 and O3 begin to be monitored, no comparisons were made. ”

item.title: Cooperation | A look at the approach to Spanish -speaking countries
item.description:
The MSAR was already approaching Spain, but the chief executive began to refer to official speeches the importance of cooperation between Macao and Spanish -speaking countries, as well as the usual Lusophone world. Analysts relate these words to the current panorama of relations between China and Spain
The chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, has expressed in some discourses the importance of having to establish economic and commercial relations not only with Portuguese -speaking countries, but also with Spanish -speaking ones. Last month, on a public occasion, the government leader stated that the territory has to "welcome foreign friends to invest in Macau and also to realize his dreams in Macao." Sam Hou Fai highlighted the area of ​​advanced technology, stressing that “they can come from Portuguese and Spanish-speaking countries” because “as long as they are in favor of economic diversification, they are always welcome,” he added. Moreover, after the inauguration of the new government, Tai Kin IP, secretary for the economy and finance, made, in March, a visit to several European countries, leading a delegation that passed through Spain, Portugal, Belgium and Monaco to deepen “international links and explore opportunities for cooperation”, according to official information released at the time. This approach to the Spanish -language universe, in addition to the usual connection already established between China and the Lusophone world, can have several origins: the growing relationship between China and Spain, as well as the desire to diversify the economy by MSAR, say analysts contacted by HM. “The interpretation of Sam Hou Fai Declaration is very objective and pragmatic and can be summed up to the Macao economy diversification project, for which companies and investors are not only in Macao, but also from Portuguese-speaking countries. But the fact is that companies and institutions in Portuguese-speaking countries are not being effective in response to this need for Macao. For cooperation it seems logical to me, ”said economist Maria Fernanda Ilhéu, former resident of Macao and president of the Friends Association of the New Seda Route (ARS). According to the leader, “Macau is a pure market economy, is classified by the World Trade Organization as a free port with its own international agreements both in the economic, commercial, investment, financial, health, sports, sports, international relations agreements with various organizations. Therefore, the business in Macau is very free, and the part of the government of Macau is to promote and frame this opening”. "As Sam Hou Fai says, all companies and investors who bring Macao economy diversification solutions are welcome," he added. To Cátia Miriam Costa, professor at ISCTE - University Institute of Lisbon, and specialist in Chinese foreign policy and Macao, considered the HM that “this connection to the Spanish stems from the high -level official visits made by the Spanish government to China, that is, there is certainly one of the consequences of the repeated presence of Spanish diplomacy on a very high level, reinforcing the ties between the two. countries ”. THE IMPORTANCE OF GLOBAL SOUTH It is true that Beijing, in the words of President XI Jinping, has shown great interest in the approach of the countries of the so -called “global south”, where Portuguese and Spanish speaks, essentially. For Cátia Miriam Costa, here also resides another explanation for the change of paradigm in the field of commercial and economic cooperation. "It seems to me that recent meetings with high Spanish political representatives have influenced this decision, along with a growing political investment in China in the global south where Portuguese and Spanish are, in fact, the most spoken languages." For Académica, "the strategy of using Macau as a convergence point may be historically justified by its cosmopolitanism, but also by its traditional role in including the routes that connected Asia to Latin America." In addition, "adds to a historical perspective, a contemporary view for a region that needs economic diversification and benefits from this proximity to distant spaces, whether historical or culturally." Cátia Miriam Costa understands, therefore, that "Spanish can be seen as an additional value to Portuguese, without distorting the paradiplomacy strategy defined for Macao early on." The inclusion of Equatorial Guinea in the Macao Forum cannot be ignored, as a result of its entry to the CPLP - community of Portuguese -speaking countries. However, Cátia Miriam Costa believes that this change has little or nothing to do with the inclusion of Spanish -speaking countries in the official commercial approach discourse.
